website_summaries.verdict: A popular vest that provides outstanding performance, even during intense workouts.
pros: Stands out for its contoured fit which hugs the body
Versatile – designed to fit men and women
cons: Users with smaller frames complain of chafing

customer_reviews.title: Im 6'0 180lbs and this vest fits like it was made for me
customer_reviews.text: Im 6'0 180lbs and this vest fits like it was made for me. Extremely adjustable for any size and super comfortable. I'm giving it 5 stars and highly recommend for anyone looking for a weighted vest. For this amount of weight at this price and the quality of this product is a steal. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas frye

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit tight enough for smaller people.
customer_reviews.text: 5'2", 125lbs female. Got this for adding weight to my workouts & runs & simulating gear. Came with a ton of extra sand bags (got the 60lb) that I have no clue where they would fit on this. Biggest problem I have is that it doesn't strap down tight enough for me in the shoulders or waist straps. Both are too long to have it fit right. Considering taking it to a tailor to have them adjust it for me. All the weight is on your shoulders, and no pockets for carrying anything if your pouches are full.
customer_reviews.author: L.J

customer_reviews.title: Tough, much tougher than me, in fact.
customer_reviews.text: I do love it, but believe it may be trying to kill me. Those numbers don't really sound that heavy until you heave this monster up on your shoulders. Well made and easy to adjust weights in 4 pound increments. Delivery was faster than promised. A pleasing transaction, except for the part where I have to use it and it wins.
customer_reviews.author: !Da!2.0

customer_reviews.title: Finally figured how to assembled
customer_reviews.text: Let me first begin by saying Youtube would probably be your best friend for assembling this, because instructions are nonexistent. My biggest grip with this product would be that it didn't come with any INSTRUCTIONS. Non the less I found a way to put it together and change my rating from 2 to 4 stars. Just using this primarily for pull-ups, push-ups, dips, and planks. Wouldn't recommend running with weighted vest because of injuries associated with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stallion

customer_reviews.title: VERY unhappy
customer_reviews.text: You would think that when you spend more than $100, on a WORKOUT VEST, you would receive all the parts necessary to use it. But I thought wrong. I was excited to get this and use it but little did I know in the 10 minutes of frustration of trying to put it together, that they didn’t send me the shoulder straps nor the belt. So now I have to wait another week because someone was paying too little attention or someone was too lazy to put these two parts that I needed to actually use it. Very very unhappy with this purchase. *i will update when I actually get to use it
customer_reviews.author: garret

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Vest delivered 2/6/2018, vest broke 2/20/2018! Less than 10 uses. I would steer clear of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeromy Cronin

customer_reviews.title: Add a weight vest to your workout!!
customer_reviews.text: This vest has elevated my Hindu squats and rotating handle pushups to another level. I'm starting at 20 pounds (10 front, 10 back), and I'll go from there. 40 pounds should last me for some time. So glad I discovered the weight vest and this is a good one. You have to attach the shoulder straps but it's easy, they have Velcro, put them on tightest setting. This will leave enough room for your head to get thru.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mihalovits

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews first and was nervous but a buddy of mine (male, 5'10") loved it. I'm a 5'7" female, lean 155 lbs. At the smallest fitting, the vest ends right at my hips and without the weight bars in the bottom front, perfect range of motion. I was worried I couldn't do burpees but no problem. Full 40 weight distribution is fine for walk/jog/hike. Easy to put together. Good quality, solid fabric and stitching. I bought this to train for the Bataan Memorial Death March and a special teams school. So far, it's exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi Mellor

customer_reviews.title: Good overall weight vest
customer_reviews.text: Overall this was a good weight vest but some workouts felt a little uncomfortable doing. If the weights were a little more ergonomically designed to not move as much within their little pockets, this weight vest would be better. The good thing about this vest is that it allows you to use it for many different workouts. I use it mainly for pushups and sit-ups, but have tested it out with a few others. Overall, good vest. Recommended to anyone who’s in search of a budget friendly vest
customer_reviews.author: Kasra

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the size
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift I bought for someone doing weight training. They liked it. They only problem with it is that it appears to fit the model well but when actually trying to use it, it appeared smaller. When I wore it (I am 6ft 2in) it stopped just above my bottom ribs. This made it a little more top heavy than expected. Other than that it was durable and weight adjustable. Would probably fit someone below 5ft 8in better.
customer_reviews.author: abauco

customer_reviews.title: Everybody Wants One
customer_reviews.text: Everybody wants one of these things. Everywhere I go, people are asking me about it. I completed Insanity Max 30 one time through and decided to buy this to do another 60 day round. The first day I had 20 lbs in it and it felt like I had never worked out before. I was tired in 5 minutes. I have now grown more used to it, but it is still hard. I will jump rope for 10 minutes with this on then take it off and do 10 more minutes. It feels like I'm walking on air. I plan to use it for basketball and increasing my vertical to get those 360 dunks this season.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not for petite women
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for petite women. I’m 5’2”, 135, muscular build. I cannot get this thing right enough. Literally all I can do with it is go for a walk or use it on the stair stepper. I wanted it to run with or use while doing HIIT.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great Vest for the Price
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a decent vest and don't want to spend a million dollars, well this is the vest for you. This item does what it was meant for, so there really isn't much to discuss here. I've used this vest while running and other workouts. It will bounce up and down, so if that is something that you don't like well look else were. The only con that I can see is that lack of breath-ability of the vest, which didn't shock me. You will sweat a lot, so be prepared for a shower after wearing this vest.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems solid. Straps are a bit long, so I have a lot of extra strap after tightening. But I guess that's better than not having enough. Obviously it's hard to get full range/depth while doing push ups with this, use push up bars. Sit ups are also restricted because the weights in the back doesn't allow you to fully bottom out. But that's common sense problems. Quality seems good, better and definitely cheaper than store bought ones, or name Brad ones. I bought it to workout on stairs (koko heaf) but havent gotten to it yet. Definitely Recommended
customer_reviews.author: gamer

customer_reviews.title: Did the job.
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that this was not what I was looking for at the time but thanks to covid this was the only one I found . For a 250 lbs guy this fit perfectly especially on my broad shoulders . Walked and ran with this and no rash or blisters. Saw comments about smell really can't comment on that since I never used it in the real which brings my only dislike that the weights are sand bags. This handled most hot humid sweaty days like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Amir Matus

customer_reviews.title: Best Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas and received it damaged from the USPS. The weights were leaking and the front half of the vest wasn't with it. I contacted MiR and while they could have told me to file a claim with USPS for a replacement, they took care of everything on their end and within 3 days I had the missing items and spare weights as well. I have never seen better customer service. 10 stars on that. The vest itself is well made, easy to assemble and add or reduce weights, and is plenty heavy for training. I would have complete confidence ordering from MiR weighted vest again.
customer_reviews.author: peted

customer_reviews.title: This works/fits perfectly for me. I'm 6 foot 190 pounds.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm loving the vest. No issues for working out (box steps, lunges, etc.) I had a pocket seam come loose in the vest the first time I ran with the vest though. The way this is constructed, it wasn't something I could easily restitch. I contacted the seller and they sent out a new one right away. Excellent customer service. They stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Whoever designed it - hats off to you. Fits me perfectly. My only complaint (aside from it slowing down my times....) is that *sometimes* it rubs my neck if I pull one of the straps too tight. It seems like, once I've done that, no amount of readjusting can reset it. Very possible it's just user error but it's only happened a few times and has never stopped my workout. Other than that, it's a fantastic vest. Great value, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vest for calisthenic workouts!
customer_reviews.text: Been having this weight vest (60 pound vest) for 2 years(3years in about 4 months), and I love it. I mainly use the vest for squats with dumbbells since I don’t own a squat rack. It’s not the best combo at the beginning since the weight vest gets in the way when you’re squatting, but it’s doable(gets some time getting used to). I also use it for jogging (and pull ups, push-ups) and again, it’s not the best feeling having 60 pounds be bouncing up and down but it’s a good way to increase the intensity of your workout.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto villegas

customer_reviews.title: Needs directions and a bigger belt.
customer_reviews.text: First off the pros- It’s very comfortable for what it is. Cons- They don’t send directions with this product. I ended up going on YouTube to figure out how to put it together. The belt that wraps around your waist isn’t that big if you’re a bigger person trying to loose weight. I have a size 46” waist, and I had to remove some of the weights, and even still, the Velcro won’t hold. Going to have to buy some duct tape just to get it to not keep popping undone.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Very poor un reliable stitching
customer_reviews.text: I initially thought it was a great product. Perfect for walking which is the only exercise I use it for. After 1 year exactly, in October, the waist wrap tore at the seams, wasn't stiched very well. Had to restitch. Since then the seams that hold the weights in the back broke, and dropped my weights mid walk. Those had to be restitched. Now the velcro holding the sholder straps padding has torn loose. The most weight I've ever used was 48 lbs for 1 hour walks. Item has never been washed, and I've always been careful with how I pick up, put on, take off, and put down the vest.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite piece of workout equipment that I own. Going for a hike? Toss it on. Taking the kids to the park? Toss it on. Mowing the yard? Toss it on. It virtually turns everything into a workout. Only negative, when your walking around, people will think this is a bulletproof vest and give you weird looks lol
customer_reviews.author: AmazonianAddict

customer_reviews.title: Heavy (60lb) nice quality, a little bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the product. The only problem is the way the shape is set up it’s very bulky. Very very bulky. I still like the product. Hard to imagine small people using it. I am 5-11” and if I do a squat wearing it the front will jam your thighs. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: 30 year old Millwright

customer_reviews.title: It's great Bc you can change the weight easily if need ...
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the stitching in the belts starting to unravel but overall the vest is a champ. She keeps up with me through my vigorous workouts until I can't take no more lol. It's great Bc you can change the weight easily if need be during the workout. I've had it for a bout 2 years now and I wanted to see how it stood to the test of Time and wear. I recommend to everyone that asks about when I walk around the gym holding the collars like bane lol I gave it 4 stars Bc of the shedding of thread from the belts
customer_reviews.author: Fletch36

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design 80lb Weight Vest Trash
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. I should have known that's why It was so cheap, and trying to return this Item was the hardest thing. Customer is Terrible. No Third Parties!!! I work alot didnt have a Printer or a place to Go to print out the Labels.. Amazon save the Day.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality and well put together vest. An 80 lbs vest is not easy to "slip" on, but I have an easy procedure to get the vest on without injuring myself. Good weight distribution front to back, top to bottom. It does touch my thighs on my squats, but it does not impede my movement.
customer_reviews.author: rlrcpa

customer_reviews.title: Not for running
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be quite large, for anyone under six feet tall, you may want to look elsewhere. I'm 5'9" 170 lbs and fit, but shoulder straps are too large. Definitely not for running as the strap to tighten is across your abdomen and limits your ability to breath.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not the most secure vest. Bounces around a lot
customer_reviews.text: High quality and well made. Though shoulder straps are not made for a petite figure, hangs lower in front than back. Both orders missing extra straps which would help make the vest more secure and prevent it from shifting around during workout
customer_reviews.author: dog/book lover w

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: First let me say I don't know how you would make a 60lb vest have good range of motion unless you're loading it up with tiny singularities. Vest arrived in good shape. It's good quality and good value. I use it for walking and weighted pullups/grip strength exercises and it functions exactly as I'd hoped. I was sent weights above and beyond the option I chose during purchase, so just keep that in mind as you load up your vest at first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customerz

customer_reviews.title: It’s good for walking but
customer_reviews.text: It’s good for walking but when you try to do push-ups with it the Velcro tends to unstrap so you have to readjust it I’m sure there could be an easy fix for this but overall this is a solid vest for the price
customer_reviews.author: Josh P

customer_reviews.title: poorly fitting and poorly padded weight vest
customer_reviews.text: does not fit right in the shoulders and put excessive stress on shoulders, neck and back as weight is not distributed properly would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: J. Gunter

customer_reviews.title: Needs easier way to put on.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this because I saw so many great reviews but after having it for a couple years now I can honestly say I wish I bought one that didn't have so many straps and Velcro. I almost always need help putting this thing on and the straps almost always get lost. The material is great and has lasted this long with plenty of use but I just hate the hassle of putting it on.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer/Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Weight Discrepancy
customer_reviews.text: I received my vest today. Out of curiosity, I weighed the vest on my digital scale - it is 5.6 lbs shy of 30 lbs. I can't help but to feel a little a bamboozled. I realize my scale could be off, but nearly 6 lbs seems excessive.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: The shoulder velcro is weak and comes undone when in use and when putting it on over my head. I don't like the sand bag pockets they are a terrible design, the bags fall out during movement. I was training to take a time sensitive physical agility test and wasn't able to send it back. I regret not returning it and buying another one somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: S.R.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for wildland firefighter training
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely outstanding!!! I'm training for Wildland firefighting and this is great for the hikes. Doesn't come with directions because all you need is common sense XD😂. Definitely recommending this to my fire brothers🤘🏻
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: It us comfortable material, causes no chafing which has happened with ...
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this so that he could improve his endurance before starting basic training, at 180lbs it fits snug, so be wary of that one thing. It us comfortable material, causes no chafing which has happened with other vests. Its adjustable, which is another great feature. He uses this daily, with no issues of weakening material or stitching. It's a well made product!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Henner

customer_reviews.title: Great Vest
customer_reviews.text: I love this vest. The only thing I wish I could change is to make it fit under my shirt. I ordered an 80 LBS vest and I wear it to work in locations were I don't come into contact with costumers. It has made a huge difference and I wish I could wear it everywhere, however because of the thickness I can't. It's well built and easily adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Osteen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this vest, and you can remove weights if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Keshia cook

customer_reviews.title: Good vest for training.
customer_reviews.text: This adjusts quite well and fits really snugly. It doesn't bounce and get all crazy when your are jumping rope or box jumping, and it's not too bulky to do your dips or pull-ups with. I weighed the little weights with a digital scale and they are not all super precise on their weights, but this serves its purpose and was so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Vest
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, etc. The water bottle elastic could be a little bigger and/or longer. My water bottle kept falling sideways even with the additional support of the Velcro strap. Overall, the weights and vest are nice.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: At first look it seemed to be a great product and even fits fairly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Received this vest on 4/19 and used it to hike a trail on 4/21. At first look it seemed to be a great product and even fits fairly comfortable. Not even 1 hour of putting this thing on one of the pockets ripped and the weight fell out. Some other pockets are starting to go as well, felt great at first but it was a waste of money to be honest. Every pocket on this thing now has to be reinforced with duct tape or modified to handle it's own weight. Do not buy, spend your money on something more hardy that doesn't fail on the weight you ordered it for!
customer_reviews.author: bryan bothwell

customer_reviews.title: It’s a monster! Are you tough enough?
customer_reviews.text: USPS messed up delivery, but this was no fault of the product. It’s a beast of a vest. Strong and sturdy, a quality item. 80lbs feels ridiculously heavy, I’m going to have to train hard to use it all! Some reviewers critised the lack of instruction on assembly but it is intuitive, it comes in 2 pieces that fit together. It’s entirely adjustable with a range of 4lbs to 80lbs. Extremes of sizes may have some issue but if you’re a regular bloke/lass it’ll fit beautifully. I strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyboy

customer_reviews.title: not very comfortable, sits very awkwardly
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed this gets points in something... What, I don't know, but something. Not exactly sure why such a simple thing needs this many velcros and straps. Overdone, not very comfortable, sits very awkwardly.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Step one to strength
customer_reviews.text: This works really perfect with my cardio. As soon as I saw this, i knew I had to have it. Putting together was easy as pie, did not even need instruction. The fact that it is adjustable makes it better for those who can’t do 40 just yet and you can slowly add one by one. This is a great vest.
customer_reviews.author: kev090

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty Weighted Vest
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 5 years ago and it still holds up after years of abuse. This vest is extremely heavy duty and well built. The price that you pay for this vest is worth it, and it is one of the most well made vest out there as it is very adjustable for all different body sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For sure buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a weighted vest that would increase his resistance when walking, this fits the bill. It would be rather bulky, if tried to lift weights with it on. Does work well for walking or even running
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is going to make me a stud!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today. I don't understand all of the reviewers having so much trouble with the straps. It was simple to assemble and I was wearing it 5 minutes after the box was opened. I took a 1 mile walk and my tracker definitely noted a higher pulse rate. I can't wait to see if my legs get stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Solid product.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 180, average build, wear a L t-shirt, 5'11''. This fits just fine. It was pretty easy to put together. I was expecting something requiring a rocket scientist based off some of the reviews. Two pieces, not hard. The velcro straps work good faced one way, and great faced the other way. You'll figure it out. I ran 6 miles with it rigged for 20 lbs. No problems. I didn't notice any strong, over powering smell that some people write about. Perhaps when I've used it more... but currently... nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie S. Black

customer_reviews.title: Nice to be able to adjust the weight front to ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice to be able to adjust the weight front to back top to bottom or how much total weight. Pocket is a nice addition as well. The downside is that the Velcro straps are not long enough for a big guy and pull off constantly. I have to use the vest with lower weight or strap it under the front section which leaves the front section flopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Kern

customer_reviews.title: Average vest
customer_reviews.text: Not the best weighted vest i have ever used, but does the job. As far as reliability, has stayed in tact for 3 years, its just not the best setup, and moves around alot when working out. Also, weights always don't fit right in the pockets, one of the bags leaks sand within 6 months, but all other ones are still in great shape. I would say if u use this for squats, lunges walking long distances, its a go... but not for intense cardio, wiggles just too much. Give it a try
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Little tight in the chest area, so when running I might have it too tight, but better that than it choking me or slapping me in the face. Ease of placing weight is magnificent, able to distribute easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great weight vest for the money
customer_reviews.text: This weight vest is great if you're trying to work on strengthening your legs. The ability to adjust the individual weights is a strong point of this product and so is the waist straps. People need to remember that depending on what you're using this for, you need to adjust the weight of your vest (10-15% of your body weight for jogging/running and 20-25% for walking/hiking). You will get some unusual looks as people tend to think this thing is a bulletproof vest. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Plaza

customer_reviews.title: This workout vest is for the serious trainers.
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this vest when I walk around my neighborhood. I usually like to walk between 2 and 1/2 to 3 miles and asbestos holding up fairly well. Some of the pocket seem to be coming apart but that could be expected when you're dealing with this kind of weight. I am going to recommend this for the serious workout person.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Greene

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this once I cancelled my gym membership and absolutely love it. It seriously makes working out so much harder. I found this very useful when I would do pull ups and push ups since I was tired of doing so many reps. FYI, I was able to do 30 pull ups nonstop. So, doing sets til failure or a ton of sets of varying (10-20) reps got pretty boring pretty quick. I also found this useful for doing planks, but sit ups and crunches was tricky at first (easier to put weight bags in the front pouches only, but slightly harder to put on with all the weight on one side).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great for long distance hiking training
customer_reviews.text: I great for long distance hiking! The added resistance is helping me get great for those long mountain hikes where I'll be caring at least a 100 lds for days at a time
customer_reviews.author: drewdog

customer_reviews.title: works well for my DDR training[Dance Dance Revolution]
customer_reviews.text: My only problem is its not made for shorter people when i kneel or anything I have to kneel oddly when i let a taller friend try it they had no problems. its also a bit uncomfortable around the collarbone area perhaps a bit more padding would do it some justice.
customer_reviews.author: samuel scott

customer_reviews.title: The strain is easily averted with a little side to side shift
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this vest 6 days a week for months. No problems at all. A little tough on the shoulders but one would expect that with 80 lbs. over 3 to 5+ miles. The strain is easily averted with a little side to side shift. It's a great work out item; essential for Fire Fighters. Makes the 130/190 wild land or wearing full structural PPE a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Roc

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 80lbs vest as I wanted options to build up to the 80lb mark. Read quite a few reviews about this vest. It was easy to put together and weight distribution is well placed.
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: just what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: good stitching good quality. A little sand in box but cant find leak on bags good vest wear often love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cody92

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 80lb vest, fairly happy with it, good support and fits nicely even. Seeing some slight fraying, but not terrible. Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: BobParker

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice quality vest and it was dead on accurate at ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice quality vest and it was dead on accurate at 60 lbs. It works very well for my workouts and does not restrict my ability to do pull ups or chin ups while wearing it. The only draw back I have found and it is minor is that the shoulder straps could use a little bit more padding. At 60 lbs it does start to dig in to your shoulders after a while.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I used to prepare for the firefighter fitness test. I think 40lbs is as heavy as I would go. I did not use for long term.
customer_reviews.author: Cody P.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help me prepare for the CPAT. The vest itself is great! I'm 5'6 170lbs and it fits comfortably. The only real complaint I have is the safety straps that came with it. The ones I received are not the ones shown in the instructions included,there are rings on both the front and back piece of the vest but I found it much easier to just secure the straps around me and use the velcro on the straps and vest to secure it. I would definitely recommend this vest, just be prepared to find your own way to secure the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! I use it for Dips in the weight room and it is very sturdy and doesn't move an inch. I also like the fact that you can adjust the weights to make the vest as light (or heavy as you want). The only down side with the vest is that it doesn't come with instruction on how to set it up. You actually have to go to Youtube to watch the video. But after you figure it out, it is 100% worth the investment. It also looks good and is sporty. I haven't tried runnign in it yet, but it seems like it would work very well for thos cross training.
customer_reviews.author: DT15

customer_reviews.title: Weights are easy to move in and out
customer_reviews.text: Well built vest. Weights are easy to move in and out. Does not stay tight when running. Lots of bounce on the shoulders. It really needs one more strap across the chest. . Overall not bad for everything but running.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Eng

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for endurance
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for husband who is in the Army preparing for a deployment. It fit well and is easily adjustable not only to fit his body but the weights are removeable allowing you to choose how much weight you want. The only complaint I have is the shipping cost. The item arrived in a large flat rate box that I know only cost $14.95 to mail and I paid more than double that in shipping. Feel a little ripped off but the item was on sale at the time of purchase so I still saved compared to what I saw it in a sports store locally.
customer_reviews.author: Busy single mom

customer_reviews.title: Tears easily
customer_reviews.text: Horrible customer service. Took over two weeks to get refunded. I liked the best until the pockets that hold the weight in place ripped after the 1st use.
customer_reviews.author: CAE

customer_reviews.title: perfect for hikes and fits big guys.
customer_reviews.text: good product! I'm currently wearing it while hiking up hills/mountains. I started with only 10lbs to condition my body and feet. I am now up to 25lbs and pressing onward to 40lbs eventually. This vest should fit big men, I am 6'1 and 250+lbs with a 60 inch chest, the vest is adjustable with Velcro straps and in my opinion it is very well made. being a big guy with broad shoulders and thick core I am very pleased with this product... Bravo.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Martinez

customer_reviews.title: It is good quality for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Gift well received. I was afraid it would not fir him, however for a man 5' 9" tall, weighs 247 lbs. It fit well. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: DJ B.

customer_reviews.title: High quality materials, but challenging design
customer_reviews.text: The vest is durable and has been a great purchase. My only issue is that the front of the vest is too long and goes past my hip (I'm 5'10"). So squats, lunges, etc. are a challenge. I can and do, however, where it backward and that solves the problem. Overall happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: amy r

customer_reviews.title: Rips under it's own weight
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'8" and 300 lbs. This vest is good for walking but when running it bounces up and down, the front of it smacking in the face with each step. One evening while running 4 miles from home, this bouncing up and down caused the velcro strap to tear out of the vest so that I had to carry it in my arms to home. It looks professional but is assembled cheaply with loose threading that pulls out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Salisbury, NC

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking in
customer_reviews.text: This vest is great if you are walking in it. Running in it, is a bit tough. I haven’t figured out how to keep it from bouncing around so much. I have also tested it with pull-ups and the shoulder straps rub my neck. Very affordable for a vest and if you plan on running or walking.
customer_reviews.author: M. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product to condition your endurance and core strength!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly, straps on tightly via velcro, doesn't bounce around while running or moving. Great quality thus far after several uses. very good cost here- Dicks and other outdoors sports stores will be double the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The bags fell through the vest after using it only a few times. So I had to place them in other pockets in order to be able to continue my workout. I don’t recommend buying it for this price.
customer_reviews.author: carla a calonge

customer_reviews.title: but this vest fits pretty well 5' 10
customer_reviews.text: Works well. 60 lbs is a lot of weight, but this vest fits pretty well 5' 10.5", 180 pounds. The straps are a bit too long, but it stays in place. I don't use it for running, but it works great for squats, lunges, push ups, pull ups, and dips. The shoulder area is a bit uncomfortable, but there is weight essentially hanging from that part, so no big surprise there. It's not terrible, and it is easy to see that it is designed to minimize discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Ryon Fuqua

customer_reviews.title: Body weight
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect for doing body weight squats, push ups and walking.
customer_reviews.author: Mateen

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, male or female
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, male or female. Material is pretty rough, so you need to wear a shirt/rash guard underneath. Lots of pockets for even weight distribution. The adjustable belt thingys are a bit long, but probably made that way for larger people, so I made a little kinda belt loop thingy to keep it in place ( I was wearing it while mowing my lawn to get a bit more of a workout, and the belt kept getting stuck on things. ). Great product, I'm up to 40lbs so far, looking to use the full 60 in a couple of months. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G Calabria

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Snug
customer_reviews.text: Love and hate this thing. Puts the extra weight on your entire frame. After a while, the weight bears the most on the shoulders. All in all, I like the extra weight and actually feel better after wearing so much weight. I'm a workhorse when it comes to working out when I get around to it. The straps are near-perfect, but hard to get off after a work out mainly because my muscles are exhausted. I hate it because I run so far and realize I have to keep this thing on on the way back. But hey, suck it up and love it.
customer_reviews.author: John White

customer_reviews.title: After your shoulders get used to the weight, you’ll want it on every time you work out.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal addition to your lunges, squats, tire flipping, hiking, and especially pull-ups and monkey bar training for OCR.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J. Stalker

customer_reviews.title: ZFO Belt
customer_reviews.text: While I like vest overall (good fit, good feel), the two Velcro belt-straps that come with the belt are junk. The straps pretty much fell apart (the seams tear loose) within the first couple of months. This is due to the stress of the belt-strap stitching contacting the velcro on the belt. If you choose this vest, then a weight-lifting belt or regular belt is a good substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good vest for alot of things
customer_reviews.text: Great for walking, hiking and working out. Not good for running, it bounces quite bit since no straps to hold it down.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: The shoulder straps could have used a bit more padding ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoulder straps could have used a bit more padding, after 30 min it starts to feel very uncomfortable. Can adjust the weights on all these models so even if you get something that too heavy for you, you can remove some of the weight pouches to lower it.
customer_reviews.author: Azavelli

customer_reviews.title: Wear this in your sleep--you'll grow muscles!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty darn sturdy. Sticks to your body and doesn't move around if you secure it well. The side straps are pretty long and hard to remove but other than that, this is great for indoor exercises, especially stationary ones like pushups and pullups. Great buy, though receiving the package is a pain since you have to sign for it and since I'm regularly out of the house, I had to lug it home from the post office. Great initiation workout.
customer_reviews.author: N. N.

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I never owned a weighted vest before and couldn't Imagine how it would feel to wear one,this vest is cofortable to wear and the weight distibution is perfect, the price was also affortable compare to vest I've seen in this weight class.One size fits all, the adjustments are good all velcro easey to adjust very sturdy, 80 lbs is plenty of weight and can be raised or lowered in 4 lb increments, I started with 16 lbs in the front and 16 in the back and thats nice and heavy I have plenty of room to add more as I get stronger, I think this vest is going to take me to the next level in my fitness goals.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: ... used this for a few runs now and it great. It may be a bit bulky but it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a few runs now and it great. It may be a bit bulky but it does what it is supposed to. It shifts a little but you can adjust it and make it tighter but will restrict you chest from taking deeper breath over all great product
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Ruiz JR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend to anyone looking for a weighted vest. As comfortable as it get when it comes to These types of vests. Good price if you’re unsure how often you actually will use it
customer_reviews.author: CMFF

customer_reviews.title: I Would Have Rather Opted For Someone that Took Their Product Seriously
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were not included in the shipment and the instructions listed on Amazon are terrible. The included weights were exposed from the slips they were fitted into. The stitching for some was coming off while others did not have any stitching on the slips at all. In re to the metal fasteners, again, the stitching is holding them in place coming loose and I just took the vest out of the box. This is absolute crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'9, 135 and the small vest fits perfectly and is adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: The pockets are pretty useless seeing as how nothing I need really fits but the vest can secure to my body enough to do some pushups and burgers and jump rope. Not ideal for running!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Savel

customer_reviews.title: Great, high quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great, high quality product. Easy assembly. I wear it hiking and doing stadiums. It was a great investment. Fits well. I'm a big guy and have a 48 inch chest and have no problems adjusting it. My girlfriend and her sister were able to put it on and adjust it as well, and they were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Velcro wore out fast
customer_reviews.text: The non-stick side of the Velcro (loop side) wore out sooner than expected. I work out M,W,F and do weighted calisthenics. Kept having to stop my exercises to put it back on but can't do really do anything with it anymore unless I buy another vest. In the time I had it, it was a good vest
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I was using a backpack with 70# before purchasing the vest. The vest, although lighter, is much more difficult to carry because it hangs the weight from your shoulders whereas a backpack is designed to put the weight on your hips. Since the goal here is to get a good workout, the vest is very effective. It is also very well made and easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: William Stuntz

customer_reviews.title: I LOVED this vest
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this vest, it was perfect for what I needed it for. I was SO sad when I accidentally left it in my house in Tennessee when I moved to Oklahoma! I am ordering again once it becomes available, I ordered at the $119 price and I'm glad I'll be able to get it again discounted now!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Love

customer_reviews.title: weighed in at 40lbs exactly +/- error rate of my cheap bathroom scale, good enuff
customer_reviews.text: as far as function goes, it's just a vest that has sandbags for weights, what more do you want ? it works. one minor complaint is the straps to hold the vest to your body, it was confusing to assemble. I had to look up on youtube on how to assemble the velcro belts. The shoulder straps were easy to figure out, but not the belts around your torso. it is durable, and comfortable to wear/walk/jog. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CriticalGeek

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This is just two sections of material that has 40lb each in it and they join together through velcro the bust off if you do any fast movements would not recommend for working out this product is unsafe
customer_reviews.author: Big dave

customer_reviews.title: a simple elastic and Velcro system could have made this nearly perfect but as it stands
customer_reviews.text: The strap system is overly complicated. a simple elastic and Velcro system could have made this nearly perfect but as it stands, it's difficult to don and doff. It does not sit securely and adjusting the straps takes way too long only to have them come loose. I've worn this for hours and I still can't seem to get it setup properly. Pretty awful.
customer_reviews.author: PepperDog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for crossfit exercises
customer_reviews.text: It's durable and very useful for long runs and the weight can be adjusted
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for new fathers and for Spartan Race training
customer_reviews.text: I love this weight vest. It is very comfortable and makes you feel like a superhero when you take it off. If you like to run with a young child, it lets you both get a good workout. I jog a mile or two with my three year old and the forty pound vest equalizes our ability. I highly recommend this for obstacle course training. I am preparing for the September Spartan Race in Vermont and this is a key to my training equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris DeMuth Jr

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fits well
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and fits well on my 5’11”, 200 lb frame. Great for push-ups, squats, and planks. For squats, the bottom of the vest slightly impedes full motion but not too bad. Would recommend for experienced folks who are already in decent shape
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Hall

customer_reviews.title: It helped
customer_reviews.text: I took the CPAT test for a Fire Department and used this a few months before I took it. It helped the Velcro sucks when you do squats ,but other than that it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good functional workout vest.
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the sand weights, i was under the impression they were lead/metal the vest came as advertised. It is a good sturdy functional vest that I would recommend. Some of the issues people have with this or any vest, cumbersome, difficulty putting the vest on based on strength levels are part and parcel for ALL weighted vest. If you are going to introduce weighted vest traing to you regiment this is a good quality vest
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Cooney

product_meta.title: ZFOsports Weighted Vest 30lbs - 80lbs
feature_bullets: Premium features: Pocket for your phone/music devices
Water bottle holder, designed to fit all water bottles 16oz or smaller
Belt attached on the vest for easy set up

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
